title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8014.00 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8014.00 - General

State Regulations
(a) IR 290. The
eastbound and westbound roadways of Youngmann Expressway, IR 290, between exit
N16 of IR 190 and exit 50A of IR 90 in the Towns of Tonawanda and

Amherst. (b) Route 33. The
eastbound and westbound roadways of the Kensington Expressway, Route 33, between Michigan Avenue and Genesee Street, Route 33, in the City of Buffalo
and the Town of Cheektowaga. (c) Route 198. The eastbound and westbound roadways of the Scajaquada Expressway, Route 198, between Thruway exit N11 and the Kensington Expressway, Route 33, in
the City of Buffalo. (d) Route 400. The northbound and southbound roadways of the Aurora Expressway, Route 400, between Route 16 and Thruway exit 54 in the Towns of Aurora, Elma and West

Seneca. (e) US Route 219. The
northbound and southbound roadways of US Route 219, between Route 39 and

Thruway exit 55 in the Village of Springville and Towns of Concord, Boston, Orchard Park and West Seneca. (f) IR 190. The northbound and southbound roadways of IR 190 between exit 53 on IR
90 and the Erie-Niagara county line in the City of Buffalo and Towns of Grand

Island, Tonawanda and Cheektowaga. (g) IR 990. The northbound and southbound
roadways of IR 990 between IR 290 and French Road in the Town of

Amherst. (h) IR 90. The eastbound
and westbound roadways of IR 90 between the Chautauqua-Erie county line and the

Erie-Genesee county line in the City of Lackawanna, Village of Williamsville
and Towns of Brant, Evans, Eden, Hamburg, West Seneca, Cheektowaga, Amherst, Lancaster, Clarence and Newstead and the Cattaraugus Indian

Reservation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
8014.00

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
